capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to someone about Professor McGonagall and I can confirm that she's indeed affiliated with Hogwarts. She's an amazing teacher and a great role model for the students there.

You know, I've always had a lot of respect for Professor McGonagall. She's an amazing educator and a fierce protector of her students. I mean, who else could make Transfiguration look so cool? (SENTIMENT: POSITIVE)

You know, I've always had a lot of respect for Professor McGonagall. She's an amazing educator and a fierce protector of her students. As the Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts, she's taught me so much about the importance of discipline and hard work in achieving magical excellence. I'm not surprised to hear that she has such a strong affiliation with the school - she's truly one of its most beloved and respected members.

You know, I've always had a lot of respect for Professor McGonagall. She's an amazing educator and an even more impressive witch. As the Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts, she's taught me so much about the importance of discipline and hard work in mastering magic. I'm not surprised to hear that she's affiliated with such a prestigious institution - it just makes sense that someone as talented and dedicated as her would be involved with something like Hogwarts.

You know, I've always had a lot of respect for Professor McGonagall. She's an amazing witch and an incredible educator. I mean, she was the Transfiguration professor here at Hogwarts for many years, and she's just so dedicated to her students. I think that's part of why she's so well-liked by everyone in the school.

It's definitely an... interesting perspective on ownership.
